headline.main: The Suicide of Macdonald.; VERDICT OF THE CORONER'S JURY SINGULAR LETTERS OF THE DECEASED.

docs.lead_paragraph: Coroner JACKMAN, yesterday morning, made an investigation into the circumstances attending the death of ROBERT C. MACDONALD, the murderer. The evidence corroborated the statement of the case which has been given in the TIMES, the only additional point of interest having been developed in the testimony of THOMAS JEFFERSON LONAN, the colored...

docs.snippet: In a letter, dated some eight or ten day's ago, I informed you of the death of Mr. TOWNER, the American Consul at this port. I repeat the announcement for letters sent by sailing vessels do not always reach their destination. The Consul died suddenly...

headline.main: THE WEST INDIES.; News from the Windward Islands.

docs.lead_paragraph: In a letter, dated some eight or ten day's ago, I informed you of the death of Mr. TOWNER, the American Consul at this port. I repeat the announcement for letters sent by sailing vessels do not always reach their destination. The Consul died suddenly of inflammation.

docs.snippet: Flag-officer McCLUNEY, of the Home Squadron, has asked to be relieved, owing to debilitated health, arising from long detention in Aspinwall Bay. He is not as ill as has been represented by one of your contemporaries.
docs.lead_paragraph: Flag-officer McCLUNEY, of the Home Squadron, has asked to be relieved, owing to debilitated health, arising from long detention in Aspinwall Bay. He is not as ill as has been represented by one of your contemporaries.
